alert.note: Alert for Wilson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 5:35PM EST until December 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham, Edgecombe, Franklin, Granville, Halifax, Nash, Orange, Vance, Warren and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 531 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain, which will cause urban and small stream flooding in the advisory area. Gauge reports indicate portions of Third Fork Creek in Durham may be coming out of its banks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Durham, Rocky Mount, Chapel Hill, Roanoke Rapids, Henderson, Tarboro, Oxford, Hillsborough, Nashville, Creedmoor, Louisburg, Warrenton, Halifax, Wilson, Carrboro, Butner, Franklinton, Elm City, Norlina and Dortches.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Slow down and use caution to avoid hydroplaning
